From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To create an interface-range macro, use the **define interface-range** command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: Name of the interface range macro; the macro name can contain up to 32 characters.
Interface range. For a list of valid values for interface ranges, see the "Usage Guidelines" section.

ExtraInfo: The macro name is a 32-character maximum character string.Amn interface range for a macro can contain up to five ranges. An interface range cannot span slots. Use this format when entering the *interface-range*:•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)*interface-type slot*/*first-interface* - *last-interface*Valid values for *card-type* are as follows: •![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**ethernet** •![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**fastethernet**•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**gigabitethernet**•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)loopback•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**tengigabitethernet** •![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**tunnel**•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**vlan** *vlan-id* (valid values are from 1 to 4094)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**port-channel** *interface-number* (valid values are from 1 to 256)•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**ge-wan**—supported on Cisco 7600 series routers that are configured with a Supervisor Engine 2•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**pos**—supported on Cisco 7600 series routers that are configured with a Supervisor Engine 2•![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)**atm**—supported on Cisco 7600 series routers that are configured with a Supervisor Engine 2

RelatedCmds.description: Executes a command on multiple ports at the same time.
